oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Use of Daily Postpartum Temperatures to select Dairy Cows for Treatment with Systemic Antibiotics
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kristula, Michaela
Smith, Billy
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Prevention
postpartum disease
economic benefit
rectal temperature
statistics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Prevention, and early detection and treatment, of postpartum disease are of economic benefit because of the potential to restore the cow to productivity sooner. Recording rectal temperatures has been widely adapted in protocols to monitor postpartum dairy cows because it is inexpensive and easy to implement. The objective of the following study was to obtain descriptive statistics on daily postpartum temperatures on 1,042 dairy cows.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2001; 182
